snippet: The Grand Slam of Golf, an exhibition event in October, was to be held at Donald Trump’s golf course in Los Angeles but will be played elsewhere in light of his comments on Mexican immigrants.
abstract: Professional Golfers Assn of America pulls PGA Grand Slam of Golf tournament, scheduled for October, from Trump National Golf Club in Los Angeles in response to Donald Trump's controversial remarks about Mexican immigrants; move is only for 2015 and does not affect future events scheduled at club; several other major golf tournaments are still set to be held at courses owned by Trump.
lead_paragraph: The Grand Slam of Golf, an exhibition event in October, was to be held at Donald Trump’s golf course in Los Angeles but will be played elsewhere in light of his comments on Mexican immigrants.

headline.main: P.G.A. Moves Event From Donald Trump Golf Course
headline.print_headline: P.G.A. Pulls an Exhibition From a Course Trump Owns
